<!--Date Change# Author Change Description--> <!--03/10/2016 2.1.41 Pronisa Baruah A new element "deviceTypeId" is added in "upgradeRecycleDetails" block in submitUpgradeOrder_1 operation request. This change is done as part of Enhanced Recycle project.--> <!--29/08/2016 2.1.40 Abhishek Introduced new optional block "upgradeRecycleDetails" in submitUpgradeOrder_1 operation--> <!--26/07/2016 2.0.39 K V Nagasharan Introduced element expectedHandset in getOrderDetails_3Response operation as part of Refresh Buyout--> <!--13/07/2016 2.0.38 K V Nagasharan Updated storeNumber to optional in updateOrderCollectionStatus operation--> <!--17/06/2016 2.0.37 K V Nagasharan Introduced new optional block "applicationDetails" in submitUpgradeOrder_1 operation as part of Refresh Buyout.--> <!--20/05/2016 2.0.36 K V Nagasharan Updated the operations submitUpgradeOrder_1,updateOrderCollectionStatus_1,confirmOrderPayment_1,setConsignmentStateInOrder_1,getConsignmentOrderDetails_1,getOrderDetails_3 and introduced confirmOrderTradeInCollection_1 operation as part of 'Refresh Buyout 2016' project--> <!--19/05/2016 2.0.35 Pronisa Baruah Updated the getOrderDetails_3 operations to query by IMEI to get the last order details of the customer. Also amended getOrderSummary_1 operation to query by IMEI to get query the summary of last order of the customer. These changes are done as part of Global Care Up and Running.--> <!--25/01/2016 2.0.34 Shravan Updated the getOrderDetails_3 operation to optionally query for product description and classification for tariff and boltons for postpay tariff details as part of Telesales Franchise Phase 2.--> <!--18/06/2015 2.0.33 Shravan Added new operation getOrderSummary as part of Online Digital R&R project--> <!--09/06/2015 2.0.32 Shravan Introduced optional element postcode in complex block ordersByCustomerSurname in the request of getOrderList_3 operation as part of C&CN project.--> <!--14/04/2015 2.0.31 Shravan Updated getOrderList_3 operation to optional query for storeNumber as part of C&CN 2015.Introduced new element in request& response.--> <!--11/12/2014 2.0.30 Shravan Update to change the occurance of returnReasonCode from manditory to optional in replacementReturnDetails from assigned products for salesable products and change the emailAddress type to string type in orderpartyDetails in getOrderDetails_3 reponse for Click and Collect Now Changes--> <!--09/12/2014 2.0.29 Shravan Updated to add 2 optional fields in orderHeader complex element of submitOrder request--> <!--05/12/2014 2.0.28 Shravan Updated to add 3 optional element in saleableProducts complex element in submitOrder request as part of ARShop Project--> <!--01/12/2014 2.0.27 Subramanyam Introduced new complex block upgradeEntitlementDetails_2Type in getOrderDetails_3 and mutiplicity of the element collectionStatus in response of getOrderList_3 is changed from mandatory to optional.--> <!--26/11/2014 2.0.26 Shravan Updated the getOrderDetails_3 Response to change the element type of 'advancedEntitlement' to 'advancedEntitlement_2Type' in upgradeDetails complex type and changed the element type of country to alpha2CountryCodeType.Also changed the element type of cardnumber to maskedCardNumberType in initalpaymentsDetails--> <!--7/11/2014 2.1.25 Shravan Updated to introduce two new optional complex elements 'orderPartyDetails' and 'orderPartyAddress' in the getOrderDetails_3 Response--> <!--07/10/2014 2.1.24 Shravan Updated getOrderList_3 and getOrderDetails_3 operation to remove elements related to archive orders in the request and response--> <!--30/08/2014 2.1.23 Shravan Introduced new complex element orderCollectionDetails in getOrderList_3 operation response and new elements storeNumber,collectionReference & collectionStatus introduced in CollectionStatus complez type of getOrderDetails_3 response for C&CN--> <!--19/08/2014 2.1.22 Subramanyam Introduced complex element "orderCollectionDetails" in the submitOrder & submitUpgradeOrder_1 request and added three new operations - getOrderDetails_3,getOrderList_3 & updateOrderCollectionStatus as part of Click & Collect-Now project--> <!--10/01/2014 2.1.21 Subramanyam Introduced new element "externalPaymentId" in paymentThroughCardType block of operations submitUpgradeOrder_1--> <!--16/09/2013 2.1.20 Subramanyam Introduced optional element "isPreOrder" in orderHeaderType block of operations submitOrder & submitUpgradeOrder_1--> <!--31/07/2013 2.1.19 LalithaKV Updated submitUpgradeOrder_1 operation to include advancedEntitlementType--> <!--26/07/2013 2.1.18 LalithaKV Added new operation confirmOrderPayment_1 as part of O2Refresh Project--> <!--26/07/2013 2.1.17 LalithaKV element "title" in CCACustomerDetailsType has been made optional--> <!--07/05/2013 2.1.16 Jamir submitOrder operation updated to add card reference details complex structure as a choice--> <!--13/02/2013 2.1.15 Amit Kumar Added The fields which contains the bank information used for Direct Debit payments for the submitUpgradeOrder as well as made the CCANumber optional.--> <!--23/01/2013 2.1.14 Amit Kumar Changed the name termInMonths to term and upgradeCCADetails to CCADetails--> <!--21/01/2013 2.1.13 Amit Kumar Added discretionaryDiscount in the 3.11.161 CCAFinancialDetailsType--> <!--07/12/2012 2.1.12 Amit Amit Kumar Incorporated the review comments, added portal details in getOrderList_2 request and getOrderDetails_2 response.--> <!--16/03/2011 2.0.7 Amit Kumar Added new operations getOrderList_2 and elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xcore="http://soa.o2.co.uk/coredata_1" xmlns:mod="http://soa.o2.co.uk/manageorderdata_2" xmlns:pcp="http://soa.o2.co.uk/pscommonpostpaydata_2"> <xsd:import namespace="http://soa.o2.co.uk/coredata_1" schemaLocation="coredata_1_1.xsd"/> <xsd:import namespace="http://soa.o2.co.uk/pscommonpostpaydata_2" schemaLocation="pscommonpostpaydata_2_0.xsd"/> <xsd:element name="getOrderList" type="mod:getOrderList"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation could return a list of orders for one of the following parameters, 1. The user portal id on the O2 Registration Platform 2. An internal unique user identifier on the O2 registration Platform 3. Mobile Phone Number If a list of orders is associated with one of the above parameters, this operation should be able to paginate through the list.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderListResponse" type="mod:getOrderListResponse"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation must retrieve a list of Orders, associated with an order identifier, provided one or more order(s) is associated with the given order identifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderListFault" type="xcore:SOAFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SOA Fault</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderDetails" type="mod:getOrderDetails"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation should retrieve the details of an order for one of the following parameters, 1. The order number associated with an order 2. Mobile Phone Number</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderDetailsResponse" type="mod:getOrderDetailsResponse"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation should retrieve the details of an order for an order identifier, provided an order is associated with the given order identifier. An additional CSA identifier needs to be provided in the input.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderDetailsFault" type="xcore:SOAFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SOA Fault</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="submitOrder" type="mod:submitOrder"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The request to submit an order request for a service.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="submitOrderResponse" type="mod:submitOrderResponse"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The response of submit order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="submitOrderFault" type="xcore:SOAFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SOA Fault</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getDeliveryOptions_1" type="mod:getDeliveryOptions_1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation/> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getDeliveryOptions_1Response" type="mod:getDeliveryOptions_1Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation/> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getDeliveryOptions_1Fault" type="xcore:SOAFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SOA Fault</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="submitUpgradeOrder_1" type="mod:submitUpgradeOrder_1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation/> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="submitUpgradeOrder_1Response" type="mod:submitUpgradeOrder_1Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation/> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="submitUpgradeOrder_1Fault" type="xcore:SOAFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SOA Fault</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <!--new operations--> <xsd:element name="getOrderList_2" type="mod:getOrderList_2"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation could return a list of orders for one of the following parameters, 1. Mobile Phone Number If a list of orders is associated with one of the above parameters, this operation should be able to paginate through the list.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderList_2Response" type="mod:getOrderList_2Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation must retrieve a list of Orders, associated with an order identifier, provided one or more order(s) is associated with the given order identifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderList_2Fault" type="xcore:SOAFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SOA Fault</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderDetails_2" type="mod:getOrderDetails_2"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation should retrieve the details of an order for one of the following parameters, 1. The order number associated with an order 2. Mobile Phone Number</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderDetails_2Response" type="mod:getOrderDetails_2Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation should retrieve the details of an order for an order identifier, provided an order is associated with the given order identifier. An additional CSA identifier needs to be provided in the input.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderDetails_2Fault" type="xcore:SOAFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SOA Fault</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="setConsignmentStateInOrder_1" type="mod:setConsignmentStateInOrder_1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation is used to update the status of each consignment of an order from stores.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="setConsignmentStateInOrder_1Response" type="mod:setConsignmentStateInOrder_1Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation is used to update the status of each consignment of an order from stores.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="setConsignmentStateInOrder_1Fault" type="xcore:SOAFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SOA Fault</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getConsignmentDetails_1" type="mod:getConsignmentDetails_1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation contain request element used to retrieve order details for a given order number, consignment number or store id.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getConsignmentDetails_1Response" type="mod:getConsignmentDetails_1Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is a response of getConsignmentDetails_1.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getConsignmentDetails_1Fault" type="xcore:SOAFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SOA Fault</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="confirmOrderPayment_1" type="mod:confirmOrderPayment_1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation contains request element used to allow a client to inform EAI that payment for an order has been taken.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="confirmOrderPayment_1Response" type="mod:confirmOrderPayment_1Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is a response of confirmOrderPayment_1Response.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="confirmOrderPayment_1Fault" type="xcore:SOAFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SOA Fault</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderDetails_3" type="mod:getOrderDetails_3"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation contains request element used to allow a client to inform EAI that payment for an order has been taken.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderDetails_3Response" type="mod:getOrderDetails_3Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is a response of confirmOrderPayment_1Response.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderDetails_3Fault" type="xcore:SOAFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SOA Fault</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderList_3" type="mod:getOrderList_3"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation contains request element used to allow a client to inform EAI that payment for an order has been taken.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderList_3Response" type="mod:getOrderList_3Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is a response of confirmOrderPayment_1Response.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="getOrderList_3Fault" type="xcore:SOAFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SOA Fault</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="updateOrderCollectionStatus" type="mod:updateOrderCollectionStatus"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation contains request element used to allow a client to inform EAI that payment for an order has been taken.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="updateOrderCollectionStatusResponse" type="mod:updateOrderCollectionStatusResponse"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is a response of confirmOrderPayment_1Response.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="updateOrderCollectionStatusFault" type="xcore:SOAFaultType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SOA Fault</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <!--new operations--> <xsd:complexType name="updateOrderCollectionStatusResponse"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The response to a request to update the collection status of a Click and Collect Now order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="result" type="xcore:ServiceResultType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="updateOrderCollectionStatus"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This service updates the status of an order - First used for Click and Collect Now.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderNumber" type="pcp:orderNumberType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="collectionStatus" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of order items to be collected by a customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="createdTimestamp" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The time at which the event occurred, e.g. time of collection or the time the order items were picked.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="storeNumber" type="mod:storeNumberType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="orderLine" type="mod:orderLineType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element name="proofOfIdentity" type="mod:proofIdentityType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="proxyDetails" type="mod:proxyDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="handsetTradeInDetails" type="mod:handsetTradeInDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="proxyDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of the person picking up the order in place of the person who made the order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="name"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Custom field name e.g. order_despatch_date</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="200"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="proxyAddress"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Address of the person picking up the order in place of the person who placed the order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="255"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="telephoneNumber" type="xsd:string"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="proofIdentityType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Proof of Identity information provided by the customer upon collection of their order. Only required when the order is collected.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="identityType" type="pcp:proofOfIdentityType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="identityValue" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The unique identifier for the proof of ID, e.g. passport serial number or card number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="orderLineType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The order lines which contain the items for which the collection status is being updated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="saleableProductLineNumber" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Generated by the client to differentiate each saleable product in an order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="products" type="mod:productsType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="productsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The products within the order line for which the collection status is being updated. At least one of the child elements must be provided.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="accessoryDetails" type="mod:accType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="handsetDetails" type="mod:hanType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="literatureDetails" type="mod:litType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="postPaySimDetails" type="mod:posType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="prePaySimDetails" type="mod:prsType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="accType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>When picking accessories, the serial number (and if relevant, the IMEI) must be supplied if available. For other collection statuses, it is not necessary to supply serial number or IMEI.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="assignedProductNumber" type="pcp:assignedProductNumberType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="serialNumber" type="pcp:serialNumberType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="imei" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Each phone is identified by an International Mobile Equipment Identity number (IMEI) that is permanently stored in the phone.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="hanType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>When picking handsets, the IMEI must be supplied. For other collection statuses, it is not necessary to supply the IMEI.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="assignedProductNumber" type="pcp:assignedProductNumberType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="imei" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Each phone is identified by an International Mobile Equipment Identity number (IMEI) that is permanently stored in the phone.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="litType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>No identifier, e.g. serial number, is relevant for literature, however for completeness, please supply this section if literature items are part of the order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="assignedProductNumber" type="pcp:assignedProductNumberType"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="posType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>When picking postpay SIMs, the SIM serial number must be provided. For other collection statuses, it is not necessary to supply the SSN.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="assignedProductNumber" type="pcp:assignedProductNumberType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ssn" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Sim Serial Number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="prsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>When picking postpay SIMs, the SIM serial number must be provided. For other collection statuses, it is not necessary to supply the SSN.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="assignedProductNumber" type="pcp:assignedProductNumberType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ssn" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Sim Serial Number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderList_3Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Response to request for order list for a particular customer. Orders returned in order of creation date, with most recent order first.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="totalOrders" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Total number of orders found (ie not limited by number of rows requested).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ordersReturned" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Number of results returned in this message.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderList" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>List of Orders.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orders" type="mod:ordersType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ordersType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Parent of high level order details.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderNumber" type="pcp:orderNumberType"/> <xsd:element name="orderID" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The internal order id.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderType" type="pcp:orderType"/> <xsd:element name="packageName" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Saleable product name. It will be a concatenation of all assigned product names that this saleable product consists of.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderDate" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date the order was created. Note this could be different from when the order is passed to the EAI Hub.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderStatus" type="pcp:orderStatusType"/> <xsd:element name="returnsOutstanding" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="partner" type="pcp:partnerType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:choice minOccurs="0"> <xsd:element name="earlyUpgradeFee" type="pcp:paymentMoneyType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CCASettlementAmount" type="pcp:paymentMoneyType"></xsd:element> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="orderCollectionDetails" type="mod:orderCollectionDetailType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="orderCollectionDetailType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Orders to be collected from a retail store</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="partyForeName" type="pcp:partyForenameType"/> <xsd:element name="partySurName" type="pcp:partySurnameType"/> <xsd:element name="postcode" type="pcp:postcode"/> <xsd:element name="orderMethod" type="pcp:channelType"/> <xsd:element name="isClickAndCollect"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Y/N Flag - Denotes whether this relates to a Click and Collect order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="N"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Y"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isClickAndCollectNow"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Y/N Flag - Denotes whether this relates to a Click and Collect Now order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="N"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Y"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="collectionStatus" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of order items to be collected by a customer</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="50"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="storeNumber" type="xsd:string" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderList_3"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Request the list of orders that meet the given selection criteria.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="commonRegistrationId" type="mod:portalEmailType"/> <xsd:element name="customerNumber" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The identifier for the customer.The Horizon Customer Number for the Legal Entity.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType"/> <xsd:element name="ordersByParcelNumber"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The list of orders of any type based on parcel number. Likely to return zero or one order records only.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="parcelNumber" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Contains the courier's parcel shipping reference number for this order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ordersForInStoreCollection" type="mod:ordersForInStoreCollectionType"/> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="rowSelectionCriteria" type="mod:ordersSelectionCriteriaType"/> <xsd:element name="returnStoreNumber" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ordersForInStoreCollectionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This section allows a retail store to list orders to be collected. Only orders submitted within the last 30 days will be returned.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="ordersByStoreNumber"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Search based on Store Number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="storeNumber" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The number of the store as known to Telefonica. This is a 4 digit number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ordersByCustomerSurname"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Search based on Customer Surname.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="partySurname" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The customers Surname.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="postcode" type="pcp:postcode" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The customers address postcode.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:choice> <xsd:choice> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="isClickAndCollect" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"/> <xsd:element name="isClickAndCollectNow" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="isAnyOrderType" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"/> </xsd:choice> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderDetails_3"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This operation should retrieve the details of an order for an order identifier, provided an order is associated with the given order identifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="orderNumber" type="pcp:orderNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Order number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Mobile Phone Number. This (or orderNumber) is the key for the order that will be returned.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="paymentReferenceNumber" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A unique identifier provided by the payment service provider.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="imei" type="xcore:imeiType"/> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="retrieveAdditionalInfo" type="mod:retrieveAdditionalInfoType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>To retrieve addition information for an order Eg:product description, classification etc</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="getOrderDetails_3Response"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Following are the optional details of an order returned, if an order is associated with the order number or msisdn (mobile phone number) or paymentReferenceNumber, which can be a post pay, prepay or DISE. 1. General information about the order including the total order amount, order status and the portal id of the user who placed the order. 2. Package(s) and items associated with packages. 3. Payment in advance details 4. Delivery address details 5. Information about the credit check activity done as part of placing the order 6. Recurring payment details for paying for the order in instalments or periodic payments.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="responseCode" type="xsd:string"/> <xsd:element name="orderHeaderDetails" type="mod:orderHeaderDetails_3Type"/> <xsd:element name="orderSourceDetails" type="mod:orderSourceDetails_3Type" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="orderReturnDetails" type="mod:orderReturnDetails_3Type" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="initialPaymentDetails" type="mod:initialPaymentDetails_3Type" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="recurringPaymentDetails" type="mod:recurringPaymentDetails_3Type" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderTotalDetails" type="mod:orderTotalDetailsType"/> <xsd:element name="saleableProductDetails" type="mod:saleableProductDetailsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="deliveryDetails" type="mod:deliveryDetails_3Type" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="creditCheckDetails" type="mod:creditCheckDetails_3Type" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="upgradeDetails" type="mod:upgradeDetails_3Type" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnedLeasedDevice" type="mod:returnedLeasedDeviceDetailsType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="upgradeOfferDetails" type="mod:upgradeOfferDetailsType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderHistory" type="mod:orderHistoryType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="collectionStatus" type="mod:collectionStatusType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderPartyDetails" type="mod:orderPartyDetailsType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderPartyAddress" type="mod:orderPartyAddressType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="promotionsTaken" type="mod:promotionsTakenType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="orderTotalDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Contains the total amount charged and other related details.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="vatTotal" type="pcp:paymentMoneyType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="vatCodeDescription" type="pcp:vatCodeDescriptionType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="vatReceiptRequired" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="vatExclusiveTotalPrice" type="pcp:paymentMoneyType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="vatReceiptProduced" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="total" type="pcp:paymentMoneyType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="collectionStatusType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details related to the collection of orders from retail stores.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderCollectionVerificationLevel" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The level of Identification and Verification required.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="storeNumber" type="pcp:storeNumberType"/> <xsd:element name="collectionReference" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A reference number used for collection purposes</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="collectionStatus"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of order items to be collected by a customer</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="50"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="orderHistoryType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A list of Order History events for the Order. Most recent events come first.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="createdTimestamp" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date time the event was created.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="createdBy" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Username or system (e.g. NDC) that made the last update.From bo_order_history.created_user.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderEvent" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Description of order status. Will contain the text COMMENT if it is a legacy comment entry, which historically had an order_state of 1 in BV.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderEventDescription" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>User friendly description of the order event.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="deleted" type="xsd:boolean"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>If order history row is flagged as deleted then the UI shows the row with a strike-through.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="lastUpdated" type="xsd:dateTime" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date and time when a set of data items/record was last updated.Formerly, when this order history record was last updated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="lastUpdatedBy" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The last person to update this order history event.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="freeFormText" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Gives further details regarding the Order History Event.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="upgradeOfferDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of the Upgrade Entitlement that was offerred to the customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType"/> <xsd:element name="channel" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details the channel from which the message originated, e.g. AFU or CFU.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="storeType" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of store. Either O2, O2 Franchise or Independent.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="retailerId" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Retailer ID of the retailer taking the order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="userId" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the system consuming the service for which statistics data is being provided, e.g. 'MyO2' for the Restful Gateway.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="upgradeEntitlementReference" type="xsd:long"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Unique ID to identify the upgrade entitlement request (v4 onwards).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="tariffProductId" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The internal tariff identifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="tenure" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Number of months since the last upgrade date, or if the customer hasn't upgraded it's the number of months since the phone was activated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="contractStartDate" type="xsd:date" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date the contract started.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="contractEndDate" type="xsd:date" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date the contract will end.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="serviceTenure" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total number of months this service has been with O2, including times of disconnection.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="lastUpgradeDate" type="xsd:date" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date of the last upgrade. In the format: ccyy-mm-dd.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="currentMonthlySpend" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The total monthly spend for the msisdn, includes the cost of the base tariff and any CCA installment.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="eligibleForUpgrade" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Flag to determine whether a customer is eligible for any upgrade on the current date.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="upgradeAvailable" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of upgrade available to the customer today, could be NONE, PAID or FREE.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="overrideAllowed" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Y/N flag that indicates whether the channel submitting the request can override the upgrade offers made or not.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="upgradeOfferExpiry" type="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date and time when the upgrade offer expires .</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="upgradeOptions" type="mod:upgradeOptionsType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element name="upgradePayment" type="mod:upgradePaymentType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="upgradePaymentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of any payment required in order to allow an Upgrade Order to be placed. For example, the amount required to clear an exisitng CCA.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:choice> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="CCANumber" type="pcp:CCANumberType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CCASettlementAmount" type="pcp:settlementAmountType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isCCAPaymentAllowed" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="earlyUpgradeFee" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Early upgrade amount paid in pence (inclusive of VAT).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isFTUPaymentAllowed" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:choice> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="upgradeOptionsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Upgrade options that were given.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="upgradeType" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of upgrade offered to a customer, options are SIMO, HANDSET and CCA.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isUpgradeAllowed" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Y/N flag that indicates whether the channel submitting the request can submit an upgrade order for the specified upgrade type.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="onAccountPaymentAccepted" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Determines whether the customer can billany hardware costs from the upgrade to their account. This will be set to N for all early upgrades and Y for standard and enhanced upgrades.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="standardUpgradeDetails" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="upgradeEligibilityDate" type="xsd:date"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A date at which upgrade is possible.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="paidUpgradeDetails" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="upgradeEligibilityDate" type="xsd:date"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A date at which upgrade is possible.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="upgradeDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of the Upgrade particulars, only present if the Order is an Upgrade.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="msisdnDetails"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="upgradeMSISDN" type="xcore:msisdnType"/> <xsd:element name="msisdn" type="xcore:msisdnType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="upgradeDiscounts" type="mod:upgradeDiscountsType"/> <xsd:element name="upgradeEntitlementDetails" type="mod:upgradeEntitlementDetails_2Type" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="creditCheckDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This field should be populated if we have information resulting of a Credit Check call to a Credit Bureau.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderCreditCheckStatus" type="pcp:creditCheckStatusType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:sequence minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>If credit Vet Was made sucessfully.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:element name="creditVetNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the internal Id used by the credit bureau to track the application, Mandatory If credit Vet was done.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="creditScore" type="pcp:creditScoreType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="lastCreditCheckDate" type="xsd:date" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Date the credit check was last performed. Mandatory if credit Vet call has been done.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="creditClassId" type="pcp:creditClassIdType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="depositDetails" type="mod:depositDetails_3Type" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="transactCreditCheckDetails" type="mod:transactCreditCheckDetails_3Type" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="legalEntityAddress"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Address of the legal entity placing the order. For a business order it will be the company. For a consumer it will be the orderer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="legalEntityCustomerName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>maximum value of 327 (comprising of title + space + forename + space + surname = a maximum of 20 + 1 + 255 + 1 + 50 = 327 - for consumers) Non Consumer type customers would have there Company_name put in the field.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="standardAddress" type="mod:standardAddressType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="previousAddress" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="standardAddress" type="mod:standardAddressType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="referralReason" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="depositDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Information about any deposits done on the order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="depositType" type="pcp:depositKindType"/> <xsd:element name="depositAmount" type="pcp:paymentMoneyType"/> <xsd:element name="depositDuration" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="depositReference" type="pcp:depositReferenceType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="transactCreditCheckDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Extra Details of the Credit Check. Returned by Transact.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="creditCheckResultCode" type="pcp:creditCheckResultCodeType"/> <xsd:element name="totalMonthlyCharge" type="pcp:totalMonthlyChargeType"/> <xsd:element name="creditLimit" type="pcp:creditLimitType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="deliveryDetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Should only be populated if physical items are needed to be dispatched, for example in an online situation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:choice minOccurs="0"> <xsd:element name="chargeableDeliveryOption"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Chargeable delivery option, for the order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="deliveryDate" type="xsd:date"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Valid delivery date for the requested by the customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="timeslot" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Delivery option code that is valid for a given delivery date.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="despatchDate" type="xsd:date" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Date that the despatch note for this order was generated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="isStandardDeliveryOption" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo"></xsd:element> </xsd:choice> <xsd:element name="requestedCarrier" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Carrier requested when the Order was placed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="destinationName" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Delivery destination, name of person. Default is the user name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="deliveryContactNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Phone contact for the delivery - Alphanumeric free text.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="standardAddress" type="mod:standardAddressType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="deliveryAddressModified" type="pcp:typeYesOrNo" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="storeDetails" type="mod:storeDetailsType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="despatchDetails" type="mod:despatchDetailsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="despatchDetailsType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="parcelNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Contains the courier's parcel shipping reference number for this order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="actualCarrier" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Name of the carrier transporting the goods to the customer.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="actualServiceType" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The actual carrier making the delivery, e.g. ROYAL MAIL or SECURICOR.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="despatchDate" type="xsd:date" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Date that the despatch note for this order was generated.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="despatchReference" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A unique reference allowing a parcel to be identified, but not the parcel number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="storeReceivedTimestamp" type="xsd:dateTime" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>When the Store received the item.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="customerCollectedTimestamp" type="xsd:dateTime" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>When the Customer picked the item up from the Store.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="storeReturnedTimestamp" type="xsd:dateTime" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>When the Customer returned the item to the Store.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="standardAddressType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Standard address information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="addressStatus" type="xsd:short" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Numeric code for the address status e.g. 0 - "Entered Manually" 1 - "Equifax Down" 2 - "Equifax Validated" 3 - "Not Entered. External systems will hold the textual descriptions for these codes locally.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="houseNameOrNumber" type="pcp:houseNameOrNumber" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="street" type="pcp:streetType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="city" type="pcp:cityType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="county" type="pcp:countyType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="country" type="pcp:alpha2CountryCodeType"/> <xsd:element name="postcode" type="pcp:postcode"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="saleableProductDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The salebale products that have been brought. Relates to the products within the catologue. Every install must have a least one of these.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="saleableProductLineNumber" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Generated by the client to differentiate each saleable product in an order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="saleableProductId" type="pcp:itemIdType"/> <xsd:element name="saleableProductName" type="pcp:saleableProductNameType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="saleableProductPrice" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The price of the saleable product in pence. Therefore 500 equates to 5.00.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="originalPrice" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The original NON DISCOUNTED price for the saleable product. This price includes VAT. This price may be compared to the original price to determine if a discount has been given. Introduced for Retentions.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="vatDetails" type="mod:vatDetailsType"/> <xsd:element name="billingAccountNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The billing account number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="billingCrossChargeAccountNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Geneva cross charge account number as known to Geneva.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="assignedProduct" type="mod:assignedProductType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="assignedProductType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Assigned Products for mobile services, includign pre pay and mobile broadband. Any of the child groups below this level can be combined with any others.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="accessoryDetails" type="mod:accessoryDetailsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element name="adjustmentDetails" type="mod:adjustmentDetailsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element name="handsetDetails" type="mod:handsetDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="literatureDetails" type="mod:literatureDetailsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xsd:element name="postPaySimDetails" type="mod:postPaySimDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="postPayTariffDetails" type="mod:postPayTariffDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="prePaySimDetails" type="mod:prePaySimDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="prePayTariffDetails" type="mod:prePayTariffDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="chargeableDeliveryDetails" type="mod:chargeableDeliveryDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="postPayInsuranceDetails" type="mod:postPayInsuranceDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="prePayInsuranceDetails" type="mod:prePayInsuranceDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="standardDeliveryDetails" type="mod:standardDeliveryDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="standardDeliveryDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of the standard delivery charge. The actual details of timeslots and address details are held in the delivery details section on the main branch. This section is just for charging purposes. Only used for online where the customer has not received the goods.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="category" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Category of the item. ACC =ACCESSORY, CDO=CHARGEABLE DELIVERY OPTION CON= CONSULTANCY, HAN = HANDSET, L2M = BULK LAND TO MOBILE, LIT =LITERATURE, POL = POSTPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT, POI = POSTPAY INSURANCE POS = POSTPAY SIM, POT = POSTPAY TARIFF, PRI = PREPAY INSURANCE, PRL = PREPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT, PRS = PREPAY SIM, PRT = PREPAY TARIFF, PTM = PREMIER TEXT MESSAGING, REV =SOFTWARE REVALIDATION SAD = SOURCE ADDRESS, SDC = STANDARD DELIVERY CHARGE, TAM = Tariff Modifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="groupId" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Allows multiple products to be associated together (e.g. a handset, sim and tariff). It has to be unique at an order level and across saleable products. It may be null for a charger for example.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="productId" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The catalogue identifier for a product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="productName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The product name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="assignedProductNumber" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Differentiates each assigned product under a saleable product. Must be unique under each saleable product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderProductPrice" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The products one off charge in pence.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="prePayInsuranceDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details needed for an insurance related to a pre pay account. NOTE pre pay doesn't refer to how the insurance has will be paid for but the type of msisdn it's related to. If client chooses to change insurance two options are available. A straightforward cancel of the existing insurance. Or the client may add insurance. If the client chooses this option if there is any existing insurance it will be removed and replaced with the new insurance</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="category" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Category of the item. ACC =ACCESSORY, CDO=CHARGEABLE DELIVERY OPTION CON= CONSULTANCY, HAN = HANDSET, L2M = BULK LAND TO MOBILE, LIT =LITERATURE, POL = POSTPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT, POI = POSTPAY INSURANCE POS = POSTPAY SIM, POT = POSTPAY TARIFF, PRI = PREPAY INSURANCE, PRL = PREPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT, PRS = PREPAY SIM, PRT = PREPAY TARIFF, PTM = PREMIER TEXT MESSAGING, REV =SOFTWARE REVALIDATION SAD = SOURCE ADDRESS, SDC = STANDARD DELIVERY CHARGE, TAM = Tariff Modifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="groupId" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Allows multiple products to be associated together (e.g. a handset, sim and tariff). Allowed values are: IMMD = Immediate Dispatch EXCH = Wait On Exchange RETL = Pick Up In Retail INFO = No Dispatch Required DSEX = Doorstep Exchange.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="productId" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The catalogue identifier for a product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="productName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The product name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="assignedProductNumber" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Differentiates each assigned product under a saleable product. Must be unique under each saleable product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="make" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Make of the a generic piece of Hardware.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="model" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Model of the a generic piece of Hardware.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="risk" type="pcp:riskType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Model of the a generic piece of Hardware.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="skuId" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The unique identifier of the SKU (Stock Keeping Unit).Nillable - Where the SKU cannot be identified this value will be set to UNKNOWN. Element will be empty if the Empty Bag Indicator is set.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="skuName" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the Stock Keeping Unit (SKU).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="imei" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Each phone is identified by an International Mobile Equipment Identity number (IMEI) that is permanently stored in the phone.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="dispatchStatus" type="pcp:dispatchStatusType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of the assigned product on an order. 0 = Dispatch Requested 1 = Cancelled 2 = Cancelling 3 = Dispatch Not Cancelled 4 = Allocate Not Cancelled 5 = Dispatch Required 10 = Dispatched 11 = Allocated 12 = Deallocated 13 = Out Of Stock 99 = Dispatch Not Required.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderProductPrice" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The products one off charge in pence.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="replacementReturnDetails" type="mod:replacementReturnDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="assignedProdReturnDetails" type="mod:assignedProdReturnDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="CCADetails" type="mod:CCADetails_3Type" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="CCADetails_3Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Contains the information about each Consumer Credit Agreement the customer has taken to pay for hardware.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="CCANumber" type="pcp:CCANumberType"/> <xsd:element name="CCAFinancialDetails" type="mod:CCAFinancialDetailsType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="CCACustomerDetails" type="mod:CCACustomerDetailsType"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="adjustmentDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of an Account Adjustment.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="productId" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The catalogue identifier for a product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="groupId" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Allows multiple products to be associated together (e.g. a handset, sim and tariff). It has to be unique at an order level and across saleable products. It may be null for a charger for example.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="productName" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The product name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="creditOrDebit" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates if this is a credit or a debit.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="adjustmentAmount" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The +value of the credit or debit. Geneva will multiply this value by -1 if a the adjustmentkind is a debit.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="adjustmentReason" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Canonical indication of why a billling account credit or debit adjustment was made.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="adjustmentCircumstances" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>CSA can record a note against the adjustment Note Geneva can store upto 255, limit this string to 200 chars in order to potentially reserve space for CSAID to be appended and stored in Geneva.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="accessoryDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details need for accessories.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="category" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Category of the item. ACC =ACCESSORY, CDO=CHARGEABLE DELIVERY OPTION CON= CONSULTANCY, HAN = HANDSET, L2M = BULK LAND TO MOBILE, LIT =LITERATURE, POL = POSTPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT, POI = POSTPAY INSURANCE POS = POSTPAY SIM, POT = POSTPAY TARIFF, PRI = PREPAY INSURANCE, PRL = PREPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT, PRS = PREPAY SIM, PRT = PREPAY TARIFF, PTM = PREMIER TEXT MESSAGING, REV =SOFTWARE REVALIDATION SAD = SOURCE ADDRESS, SDC = STANDARD DELIVERY CHARGE, TAM = Tariff Modifier.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="groupId" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Allows multiple products to be associated together (e.g. a handset, sim and tariff). It may be null for a charger for example.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="dispatchMethod" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The method used to dispatch the product. Must be unique under each saleable product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="make" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Make of the a generic piece of Hardware.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="model" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Model of the a generic piece of Hardware.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="risk" type="pcp:riskType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Model of the a generic piece of Hardware.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="skuId" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The unique identifier of the SKU (Stock Keeping Unit).Nillable - Where the SKU cannot be identified this value will be set to UNKNOWN. Element will be empty if the Empty Bag Indicator is set.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="skuName" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Serial number of item.Type of serial number is indicated in serial number type field but will contain the IMEI for handset order lines and SSNs for SIM card order lines.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="imei" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Each phone is identified by an International Dispatch Required 10 = Dispatched 11 = Allocated 12 = Deallocated 13 = Out Of Stock 99 = Dispatch Not Required.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="orderProductPrice" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The products one off charge in pence.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="replacementReturnDetails" type="mod:replacementReturnDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="assignedProdReturnDetails" type="mod:assignedProdReturnDetailsType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="assignedProdReturnDetailsType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="returnReasonCode" type="pcp:returnReasonCodeType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnReasonDescription" type="pcp:returnReasonDescriptionType"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnReasonSubTypeCode" type="pcp:returnReasonSubTypeCodeType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnReasonSubTypeDescription" type="pcp:returnReasonSubTypeDescriptionType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="replacementMethod" type="pcp:replacementMethodType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="returnNotes" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Free text field containing reason for return (order level).</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnCondition" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The code for the return condition of an item.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnTimestamp" type="xsd:dateTime" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The date and time the phyiscal item has been returned.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="returnAuthorisationNumber" type="pcp:returnAuthorisationNumberType" minOccurs="0"/> <xsd:element name="replacedByOrderNumber" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The order number from the order which replaced the product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="replacedByOrderLineNumber" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The saleable product line number from within the order which replaced the product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="replacedByOrderAssignProdNumber" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The assigned product number from the order which replaced the product.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="replacementPolicyId" type="pcp:replacementPolicyIdType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> <xsd:element name="replacementPolicySOACode" type="pcp:replacementPolicyCodeType" minOccurs="0"></xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="replacementReturnDetailsType"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderNumberBeingReturned" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This order
