Perceived risk for accessories (category = ACC): 0 Low Risk 1 Normal Handset Risk 2 High Handset Risk</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:short"> <xsd:enumeration value="0"/> <xsd:enumeration value="1"/> <xsd:enumeration value="2"/> <xsd:enumeration value="3"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="paymentMoneyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The one off payment to be applied in pence.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="itemCategoryType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Category of the item. ACC = ACCESSORY CDO = CHARGEABLE DELIVERY OPTION CON = CONSULTANCY HAN = HANDSET L2M = BULK LAND TO MOBILE LIT = LITERATURE POL = POSTPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT POI = POSTPAY INSURANCE POS = POSTPAY SIM POT = POSTPAY TARIFF PRI = PREPAY INSURANCE PRL = PREPAY LOGICAL PRODUCT PRS = PREPAY SIM PRT = PREPAY TARIFF PTM = PREMIER TEXT MESSAGING REV = SOFTWARE REVALIDATION SAD = SOURCE ADDRESS SDC = Standard Delivery Charge TAM = Tariff Modifier</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="ACC"/> <xsd:enumeration value="CDO"/> <xsd:enumeration value="CON"/> <xsd:enumeration value="HAN"/> <xsd:enumeration value="L2M"/> <xsd:enumeration value="LIT"/> <xsd:enumeration value="POI"/> <xsd:enumeration value="POL"/> <xsd:enumeration value="POS"/> <xsd:enumeration value="POT"/> <xsd:enumeration value="PRI"/> <xsd:enumeration value="PRL"/> <xsd:enumeration value="PRS"/> <xsd:enumeration value="PRT"/> <xsd:enumeration value="PTM"/> <xsd:enumeration value="REV"/> <xsd:enumeration value="SAD"/> <xsd:enumeration value="SDC"/> <xsd:enumeration value="TAM"/> <xsd:enumeration value="MISC"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="accountSetReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The unique identifier for account details. This is used to allow the same account details to be associated with multiple products without having to repeat the account details.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="chargeToCrossChargeAccountReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The account number unique identifier, as allocated by the requester that the charge is to be put on, It will map to a accountSetReference element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="makeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Make of the a generic piece of Hardware, may be an Accessory or SIM for example</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="modelType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Model of the a generic piece of Hardware, may be an Accessory or SIM for example</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="lastPaymentOrigin"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Field indicating the origin of the payment. Can be: PHYSICAL PAYMENT, BALANCE TRANSFER</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="lastPaymentStatus"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of the last payment Successful, Cancelled, Failed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="lastPaymentMethod"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The payment method last associated with the entity</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="currencyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Payment currency type. Allowed value is GBP.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="GBP"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="userAccountNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Type for user account number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="6"/> <xsd:maxLength value="12"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="telephoneContactType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Telephone contact type</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="telephoneNumber" type="cpd:telNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Contact telephone number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="extensionNumber" type="cpd:extensionNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Contact extension number for the telephone.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleType name="addressFormatType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Address format type.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="2"/> <xsd:maxLength value="2"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="positionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Position type.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="40"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="departmentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Department type.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="40"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="extensionNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Extension number type.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="8"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="initialsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Customer or Contact's initial value.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="firstNameType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Customer or Contact's First Name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="100"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="lastNameType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Customer or Contact's Last Name.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="100"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="typeHorizonId"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="typeHorizonDomain"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the common registry domain name for the user. Maps to EAI OIP DB ORDER_PARTY.PORTAL_ID_DOMAIN</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="typeDescriptionSize50"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Generic type that can be used for an string field, max length 50.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="50"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="vatAmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The VAT rate to calculate the VAT amount on the price.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="vatAmount" type="cpd:paymentMoneyType"/> <xsd:element name="vatRate" type="xsd:double"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleType name="vatReversalReceiptStatusType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of the VAT reversal.Values: 'R' - Ready for production 'P' - Receipt produced 'N' - Not Applicable 'X' - Receipt not required.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="1"/> <xsd:enumeration value="R"/> <xsd:enumeration value="P"/> <xsd:enumeration value="N"/> <xsd:enumeration value="X"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="residenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The following are the possible values but is not a comprehensive list: FULL DRIVING LICENCE,NI DRIVING LICENCE,UTILITY BILL,BANK STATEMENT, BUILDING SOCIETY STATEMENT,CREDIT CARD STATEMENT,INSURANCE POLICY,MAIL ORDER STATEMENT, FAMILY ALLOWANCE BOOK,MORTGAGE REPAYMENT STATEMENT,COUNCIL TAX STATEMENT,SORT CODE</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="lineNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Used in conjunction with oid to identify a particular order line.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="10"/> <xsd:pattern value="\d{1,10}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="skuType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SKU Type. e.g. 044-01-01-002-0005-0001-0001-003.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="50"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="typeDescriptionSize20"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Generic type that can be used for an string field, max length 20.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="typeDescriptionSize80"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Generic type that can be used for an string field, max length 80.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="80"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="typeCreditCardNumber"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Representation of a credit card number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="12"/> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> <xsd:pattern value="\d{12,20}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="typeCardIssueNumber"> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="3"/> <xsd:pattern value="\d{1,3}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="horizonHouseNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The house number is restricted to 20 chars.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="creditClassIdType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The credit class to which this account belongs for the purpose of debt escalation [collections].It must be a valid identifier of a credit class that currently exists in the database. It must not be null. The values are: 1=Consumer - High Risk 2=Consumer - Medium Risk 3=Consumer - Low Risk 4=Consumer - High Risk 5=Consumer - Medium Risk 6=Consumer - Low Risk 7=Consumer Cheque High Risk 8=Consumer Cheque Low Risk 9=Consumer DD or CCA 10=SME Cheque High Risk 11=SME Cheque Low Risk 12=SME DD or CCA</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="paymentMethodType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates the method of payment for the recurring payment details e.g. card, bank or Geneva account.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="CARD"/> <xsd:enumeration value="BANK"/> <xsd:enumeration value="GENEVA"/> <xsd:enumeration value="MTBILLING"/> <xsd:enumeration value="CHEQUE"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="orderStatusType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates the order status.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="61"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="proofOfIdType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Proof of Id details.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="idType" type="cpd:idType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Allowed values are: CHEQUE FULL DRIVING LICENCE NI DRIVING LICENCE PASSPORT BANK/STORE CARD FIREARMS LICENSE PURCHASE ORDER BUSINESS HEADED LETTER PROVISIONAL DRIVING LICENCE ARMED FORCES ID</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="data" type="cpd:stringSize255"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="proofOfResidenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Proof of residence details.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="residenceType" type="cpd:residenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>FULL DRIVING LICENCE, NI DRIVING LICENCE, UTILITY BILL, BANK STATEMENT, BUILDING SOCIETY STATEMENT, CREDIT CARD STATEMENT, INSURANCE POLICY, MAIL ORDER STATEMENT, FAMILY ALLOWANCE BOOK, MORTGAGE REPAYMENT STATEMENT, COUNCIL TAX STATEMENT, SORT CODE</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="data" type="cpd:stringSize255"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="orderLineKeyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifies a particular order line.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="orderId" type="xsd:string"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Key to the order that the order line belongs to.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="lineNumber" type="cpd:lineNumberType" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Order line within the order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleType name="orderIdType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Representation of an order ID. It can also be used in conjunction with a line number to identify a particular package or item within an order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="10"/> <xsd:pattern value="\d{1,10}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="assignNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Representation of assigned product number</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="10"/> <xsd:pattern value="\d{1,10}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="shortCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Short code</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="cardIssuerType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Bank Card Issuer</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="MAESTRO"/> <xsd:enumeration value="SOLO"/> <xsd:enumeration value="VISA"/> <xsd:enumeration value="MASTERCARD"/> <xsd:enumeration value="DELTA"/> <xsd:enumeration value="AMEX"/> <xsd:enumeration value="ELECTRON"/> <xsd:enumeration value="SWITCH"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="callContactIDType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Identifier to associate a customer contact message (within the customer Contact system) with actions taken in other systems such as placing new orders. It can be used to tie upsell items to an order. Also used for to calculate commissions for retention CSA's.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="paymentAuthStatusType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Payment Authorisation Status. Possible values are: REFERRED, OK or NOT DONE</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="REFERRED"/> <xsd:enumeration value="OK"/> <xsd:enumeration value="NOT DONE"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="authorisationRespCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Code from the payment system to indicate authorisation success/failure</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:short"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="authorisationRespMessageType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Text explanation of authorisation response code</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="255"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="authorisationCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Authorisation Code returned by the Merchant Acquirer for successful authorisations</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="10"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="authMessageType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A textual message returned by the acquirer</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="255"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="buynetIdType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This will be the Transaction ID</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="cv2AvsCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Response code from Buynet indicating validity of cv2 and avs details. Three digit code. If the buynetResponseCode is 625, then it is set to failed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="6"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="cv2AvsActionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Pass/fail derived from the buynet response code, set to FAIL if response code is 625</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="PASS"/> <xsd:enumeration value="FAIL"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="threeDSecureType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Contains the information required for 3D Secure processing</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="verify" type="cpd:typeYesOrNo"/> <xsd:element name="browser" type="cpd:browserType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="browserType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Information about the access medium needed to complete the 3D payment</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="deviceCategory" type="cpd:deviceCategoryType"/> <xsd:element name="acceptHeaders" type="cpd:acceptHeadersType"/> <xsd:element name="userAgent" type="cpd:userAgentType"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleType name="deviceCategoryType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Indicates the type of device or channel being used. 0 = The client environment is such that the full size messages (PAReq/PARes) will be used and the core protocol specification governs. For example, PC 1 = The client is a constrained device, such as WAP phone, where the condensed messages (CPRQ/CPRS) will be used and the Extension for Mobile Internet Devices must be followed. 2 = The client uses two-way messaging (SMS or USSD) and the Extension for Voice and Messaging Channels must be followed. 3 = The client uses the voice channel and the Extension for Voice and Messaging Channels must be followed.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:int"> <xsd:enumeration value="0"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="acceptHeadersType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The exact content of the accept attribute of the HTTP header as sent to the merchant from the card holders browser</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="userAgentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The exact content of the user-agent attribute of the HTTP header as sent to the merchant from the card holders browser</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="orderProductPriceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The products one off charge in pence.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="\d{1,14}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="pacType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The porting authorisation code allowing a temporary MSISDN to be replaced with a permanent number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="orderProductChargeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The products recurring payment's in pence, eg: monthly charges</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="\d{1,14}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="contractTermType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The length of a contract in months</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:int"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="billingAccountNameType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A descriptive name for the billing account</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="partySetReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The unique identifier for customer details. This is used to allow the same customer details to be associated with multiple products without having to repeat the cutsomer details</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="accountBillingContactReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The unique internal identifier for the customer, as assigned by the requester, that is the billing contact for this account. It will map to a partySetReference element. May be either an individual or a company.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="accountAdditionalChooserReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The unique internal identifier for the customer, as assigned by the requester, that is the an additional Chooser this account. It will map to a partySetReference element. May be either an individual or a company.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="accountLegalEntityReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The unique internal identifier for the customer, as assigned by the requester, that is legally responsible for this account. It will map to a partySetReference element. May be either an individual or a company.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="chequePaymentsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A single 'Y' character identifying that the customer is going to make recurring payments by cheque</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="Y"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="userBankAccountNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The raw user-entered bank account number, i.e. this is their bank account number as far as the customer is concerned. Stored in encrypted format.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="124"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="preferredContactMethodType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The preferred contact method:EMAIL, SMS, PHONE</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="5"/> <xsd:enumeration value="SMS"/> <xsd:enumeration value="EMAIL"/> <xsd:enumeration value="PHONE"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="passwordType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>User password</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="16"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="partyTitleType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The title used by the customer</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="8"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="partyForenameType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The customers Forname</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="35"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="partyMiddleNameType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The customers MiddleName</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="35"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="partySurnameType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The customers Surname</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="35"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="partyMaritalStatusType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A single uppercased character Indicating the customers Marital Status, the up to date list of values can be found in the ICD in the service definition.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:length value="1"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="customerTypeTextType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of customer. CON - Consumer SOL - Sole Trader PAR - Partnership LTD - Limited Comany CHA - Charity</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="3"/> <xsd:enumeration value="CON"/> <xsd:enumeration value="SOL"/> <xsd:enumeration value="PAR"/> <xsd:enumeration value="LTD"/> <xsd:enumeration value="CHA"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="addressHouseNameType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Postal House Name</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="35"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="addressHouseNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Postal HouseNumber</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="10"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="address1stLineType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>First line of the postal address normally street</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="35"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="address2ndLineType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optional second line of the postal address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="35"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="address3rdLineType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optional third line of the postal address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="35"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="address4thLineType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Optional fourth line of the postal address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="35"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="addressDistrictType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Postal District</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="35"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="addressTownType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Postal Town</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="35"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="addressCountyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Postal County</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="35"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="addressPostCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Postal PostCode</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="5"/> <xsd:maxLength value="8"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="equifaxPTCABSIDType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Result Code return by Equifax for AdressCheck against this Address</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="11"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="proofOfIdentityType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>One or two digit code that represents a type of a proof of identity, the up to date list of values can be found in the Service Specification document</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="\d{1,2}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="proofOfAddressType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>One or two digit code that represents a type of a proof of address, the up to date list of values can be found in the Service Specification document</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="\d{1,2}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="proofOfIdentityReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Serial number that idintifies uniquely the Identity proof</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="jobTitleType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Job Title of company contact</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="jobFunctionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Job Function of company contact</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="companyRegistrationNoType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>For SMEs, the Company Registration Number</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="companyPhoneNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>For SMEs, the MSISDN or phone number of the Company</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="13"/> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="typeYes"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Used in xsd:choice to indicate one among the choice should be selected ex. in a choice of Standard Delivery Option and Chargeable Delivery Option this type can used for Standard Delivery Option</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="1"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Y"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="orderPlacedByPartyReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The unique identifier for customer details as assigned by the requester.. This is used to allow the same customer details to be associated with multiple products without having to repeat the cutsomer details</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="legalEntityPartyReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The unique identifier for customer details as generated by the requester. This is used to allow the same customer details to be associated with multiple products without having to repeat the cutsomer details.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="creditCheckStatusType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Status code is a number varying from 1 to 99, the up to date list of values can be found in the service specification document</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="\d{1,2}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="creditVetNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the internal Id used by the credit bureau to track the application, Mandatory If credit Vet was done</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="\d{1,11}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="depositKindType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of deposit SERVICE Deposit for basic phone service/handset VAS Deposit for Value Added Services such as International Roaming</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="VAS"/> <xsd:enumeration value="SERVICE"/> <xsd:enumeration value="ESMEBOND"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="depositReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The reference number for the deposit generated by the entity where the deposit was billed</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="creditScoreType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The creditVet Score returned from the Credit Bureau</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="-?\d{1,6}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="referralReasonType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The reason that the credit check was referred. Mandatory if creditCheckStatus is "REFERRED". Possible values VETTING_REFERRED: The credit checking agency returned a status of 'Refer' and Back Office checking is required. DEPOSIT_MORE_DETAILS_REQ</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> <xsd:enumeration value="VETTING_REFERRED"/> <xsd:enumeration value="DEPOSIT_MORE_DETAILS_REQ"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="creditCheckResultCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Single uppercased Letter identifying the Credit Decision returned by Transact A - Accept D - Declined E - Error R - Refer Z - Additional Information Required C - Continue</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="A"/> <xsd:enumeration value="D"/> <xsd:enumeration value="E"/> <xsd:enumeration value="R"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Z"/> <xsd:enumeration value="C"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="totalMonthlyChargeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Total Monthly Charge for the Given Order</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="\d{1,14}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="creditLimitType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>maximum amount of credit that allowed for the current order.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="\d{1,14}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="ruleValidateCheckType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The result of the validation Rules 0 - PASS 1 - FAIL 2 - REFER 3 - NOT DONE</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"> <xsd:enumeration value="0"/> <xsd:enumeration value="1"/> <xsd:enumeration value="2"/> <xsd:enumeration value="3"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="ruleValidationStringType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>String containing the result of the Rule validation. In the formatXXXXXXXX where X 0, 1 or 2 for PASS, FAILED or REFER as above</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="[0123]{9}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="outcomeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>SUCCESSFUL/FAILURE</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="SUCCESSFUL"/> <xsd:enumeration value="FAILURE"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="addressValidationStatusType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of the address check performed by Equifax or Capscan. Only applied to a customer address not the delivery address. Valid values are: 0 - EQUIFAX. Verified using Equifax address search 1 - BROKEN. Address validation could not be performed for technical reasons 2 - PROOF. Customer has provided proof of address documentation 3 - NONE. Address not validated 4 - CAPSCAN. Verified using CapScan address search. Only applied to a customer address not the delivery address. External systems will hold the textual descriptions for these codes locally.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:short"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="callTypeIndicatorType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>It takes the following values, OUTBOUND = pro-active or INBOUND = reactive order This is used for commisions/retention.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="INBOUND"/> <xsd:enumeration value="OUTBOUND"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="portalRegistationIdDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The portal details, such as portal name and portal domain.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="portalUserId" type="xsd:string"/> <xsd:element name="portalDomain" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleType name="storeNameType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Store Name like Slough - Curzon Mall</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="255"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="storeNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>four character Store Identifier like 0001</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:length value="4"/> <xsd:pattern value="[0-9]{4}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="CCANumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The External Consumer Credit Agreement Number.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="50"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="serviceIdType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>A sequential integer to represent one service</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="hardwareRRPType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This the original cost of the hardware item before any discounts and down payments in pence</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="hardwareDescriptionType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The description of the hardware associated with the CCA</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="255"/> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="CCATermType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The term of the Consumer Credit Agreement in months.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="instalmentAmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the amount of money in pence that is to be paid each month.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="mandateType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of mandate e.g. Credit Card - 14 days, Direct Debit - 14 days.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="40"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="mandateReferenceType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of mandate e.g. Credit Card - 14 days, Direct Debit - 14 days.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="mandateStatusType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The state the mandate is in e.g. Expired, Pending, Active, Used, One-Time.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="40"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="branchName"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Branch of the financial institution were the customer is registered.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="50"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="cardIssuer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Numeric Value Maps to 0 - Maestro 1 - Solo 2 - Visa 3 - Mastercard 4 - Delta 5 - AMEX 16 - Electron</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="3"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="userBankAccountNameType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The customer name defined on the Bank Account.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="255"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="userBankSortCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Bank Account sort code.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="8"/> <xsd:maxLength value="9"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="treatmentStatus"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The treatment status</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> <xsd:enumeration value="INTREATMENT"/> <xsd:enumeration value="NOTINTREATMENT"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="orderCreditCheckStatusType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Status code is a number varying from 1 to 99, the up to date list of values can be found in the service specification document</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="\d{1,2}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="treatmentActionCodeType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The treatment code that is stored in geneva. This is relates to the debt escalation attribute of the account. For example 3114 Service Deny (CON10A)</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="30"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="discountAmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The discount given to hardware based on the airtime choosen. In pence e.g. 20GBP equals 2000</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="downPaymentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount of money in pence that will be paid upfront for the hardware in pence</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="totalCreditType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount of money in pence that will be provided in credit. e.g. 20GBP equals 2000</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="CCAFileDetailsType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Details of a file</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="fileContent" type="cpd:fileContentType"/> <xsd:element name="fileType" type="cpd:fileType"/> <xsd:element name="fileName" type="cpd:fileNameType" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:simpleType name="fileContentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The content of the file</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:base64Binary"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="fileNameType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The name of the file</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="fileType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The type of file e.g. PDF</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="CCAStatusType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The status of the CCA.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="finalPaymentType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount of money in pence that will be paid upfront for the hardware in pence</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="discretionaryDiscountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is a discretionary discount given at the time of purchase.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="cardReferencePaymentIdType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Reference payment identifier which uniquely identifies the payment made by the card</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="externalPaymentIdType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>External payment identifier used for providing refunds</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="cancellationAmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The amount paid, in pence, when the CCA was cancelled.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="settlementAmountType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the full amount of money in pence that needs to be paid to discharge the loan. This is the value at the time the record was created.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="partyTitle_2Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Representation of a title.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="100"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="partyForename_2Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Customer or Contact's First Name</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="100"/> <xsd:pattern value="[A-Z,a-z,0-9,\-,\s][A-Z,a-z,0-9,\-,.,\s,']*"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="partySurname_2Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Customer or Contact's First Nam</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="100"/> <xsd:pattern value="[A-Z,a-z,0-9,\-,\s][A-Z,a-z,0-9,\-,.,\s,']*"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="alternativeContactNumberType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An alternative phone number for contact.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="20"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="partyEmailAddress_2Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The customers email address eg: johndoe@domain.com</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="5"/> <xsd:maxLength value="75"/> <xsd:pattern value="[^@]+@[^\.]+\..+"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:schema>

con:call.name: Request 1
con:call.con:request: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:man="http://soa.o2.co.uk/manageorderdata_2">\r <soapenv:Header/>\r <soapenv:Body>\r <man:confirmOrderPayment_1>\r <!--You have a CHOICE of the next 2 items at this level-->\r <man:orderNumber>?</man:orderNumber>\r <man:orderIdentifier>?</man:orderIdentifier>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <man:amount>?</man:amount>\r </man:confirmOrderPayment_1>\r </soapenv:Body>\r </soapenv:Envelope>

con:call.con:request: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:man="http://soa.o2.co.uk/manageorderdata_2">\r <soapenv:Header/>\r <soapenv:Body>\r <man:confirmOrderTradeInCollection_1>\r <!--You have a CHOICE of the next 2 items at this level-->\r <man:orderNumber>?</man:orderNumber>\r <man:orderIdentifier>?</man:orderIdentifier>\r <man:handsetMake>?</man:handsetMake>\r <man:handsetModel>?</man:handsetModel>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <man:imei>?</man:imei>\r </man:confirmOrderTradeInCollection_1>\r </soapenv:Body>\r </soapenv:Envelope>

con:call.name: Request 1
con:call.con:request: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:man="http://soa.o2.co.uk/manageorderdata_2">\r <soapenv:Header/>\r <soapenv:Body>\r <man:getConsignmentDetails_1>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <man:orderNumber>?</man:orderNumber>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <man:consignmentNumber>?</man:consignmentNumber>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <man:storeNumber>?</man:storeNumber>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <man:retrieveAdditionalInfo>\r <!--1 or more repetitions:-->\r <man:parameterName>?</man:parameterName>\r </man:retrieveAdditionalInfo>\r </man:getConsignmentDetails_1>\r </soapenv:Body>\r </soapenv:Envelope>

con:call.name: Request 1
con:call.con:request: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:man="http://soa.o2.co.uk/manageorderdata_2">\r <soapenv:Header/>\r <soapenv:Body>\r <man:getDeliveryOptions_1>\r <man:orderType>?</man:orderType>\r <man:orderDate>?</man:orderDate>\r <man:postCode>?</man:postCode>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <man:isActiveReplacement>?</man:isActiveReplacement>\r </man:getDeliveryOptions_1>\r </soapenv:Body>\r </soapenv:Envelope>

con:call.name: Request 1
con:call.con:request: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:man="http://soa.o2.co.uk/manageorderdata_2">\r <soapenv:Header/>\r <soapenv:Body>\r <man:getOrderDetails>\r <man:userId>?</man:userId>\r <!--You have a CHOICE of the next 2 items at this level-->\r <man:orderNumber>?</man:orderNumber>\r <man:msisdn>?</man:msisdn>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <man:isArchiveOrderRequired>?</man:isArchiveOrderRequired>\r </man:getOrderDetails>\r </soapenv:Body>\r </soapenv:Envelope>

con:call.con:request: <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:man="http://soa.o2.co.uk/manageorderdata_2">\r <soapenv:Header/>\r <soapenv:Body>\r <man:getOrderDetails_2>\r <man:userId>?</man:userId>\r <!--You have a CHOICE of the next 2 items at this level-->\r <man:orderNumber>?</man:orderNumber>\r <man:msisdn>?</man:msisdn>\r <!--Optional:-->\r <man:isArchiveOrderRequired>?</man:isArchiveOrderRequired>\r </man:getOrderDetails_2>\r </soapenv:Body>\r </soapenv:Envelope>
